block.p: Karen Elizabeth Weir and Mallory Factor are to be married today at the Hotel San Pietro in Positano, Italy. Rabbi Joshua Lookstein is to officiate with Positano's mayor, Octavio Fusco.

The bride, who is known as Elizabeth, is an investment banker at Babcock & Brown in New York. She graduated from Columbia University and received a law degree from Yale University. She is a trustee of the Drawing Center, a museum in New York.
Karen Elizabeth Weir and Mallory Factor are to be married today at the Hotel San Pietro in Positano, Italy. Rabbi Joshua Lookstein is to officiate with Positano's mayor, Octavio Fusco.

The bride, who is known as Elizabeth, is an investment banker at Babcock & Brown in New York. She graduated from Columbia University and received a law degree from Yale University. She is a trustee of the Drawing Center, a museum in New York.

The bride is the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James R. Weir of Orlando, Fla. Her father is the chief pilot of Airtrans Airways, based in Orlando. Her mother, Karen H. Weir, is the president of Added Dimensions, an interior design firm there.

Mr. Factor is the chairman and chief executive of a financial consulting firm and merchant bank that bears his name in New York. He is also a trustee of the Brooklyn Academy of Music and an advisory board member of the American Theater Wing. He graduated from Wesleyan. His previous marriage ended in divorce.

The bridegroom is the son of Sylvia Klein Factor of Bridgeport, Conn., and of the late Martin H. Factor. His mother retired as a scheduling manager at Raybestos Manhattan, a former maker of automobile brake pads in Stratford, Conn. His father was the executive vice president of International Knitting Mills, which made outerwear in Wallingford, Conn.
